intro: Eriocephalus pterophiloides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in rocky and sandy soils, thriving in full sun. It produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind, aiding in its propagation. Eriocephalus pterophiloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
